October 10
-
October 31
WATERCOLOR FUNDAMENTALS
Artist-Instructor: Sunny Krchmar
Event Category:
Fine Art
Fridays, October 10, 17, 24, 31, 2025,
9:00 AM – 12:00 PM
Beginning watercolor artists will be introduced to basic watercolor supplies and techniques. Under Sunny’s guidance, students will work at their own pace during this 4-week class that will help to jump start your creativity.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More
October 10
-
November 14
CERAMICS OPEN STUDIO
Studio Monitor: Tim Smith
Event Category:
Pottery
Fridays, October 10, 17, 24, 31 & November 7, 14, 2025, 9:30 AM – 12:30PM
Students who are registered in the October/November 6-week pottery sessions will be allowed to participate in these Friday open studio classes. The open studio will offer current students extra time outside of class to continue and complete their artwork.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More
October 13 @ 7:00 pm
Young Frankenstein
Event Category:
Film Series
As a respected researcher and physician, Dr. Frederick Frankenstein, the grandson of the more famous Dr. Victor Frankenstein, who did experiments on bringing back the dead, tries to disassociate himself from his more famous relative.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More
October 20
-
October 21
DISCOVER WATERCOLOR PENCILS
Master Artist-Instructor: Melissa Miller Nece
Event Category:
Fine Art
Monday, October 20 & Tuesday October 21, 2025, 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM
Watercolor pencils = Drawing + Painting! They combine the precision and control of pencil drawing with the fluid possibilities of paint. Explore the many ways these versatile pencils can be used – wet or dry, alone or for mixed media.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More
October 20 @ 7:00 pm
The Addams Family Values
Event Category:
Film Series
When an adorable baby boy is added to the Addams household, Wednesday and Pugsley do not hate him, they just aren’t necessarily excited about his existence.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More
October 27
-
October 28
Fluid Art Masterclass
Artist-Instructor: Tammy DeCaro
Event Category:
Fine Art
Monday, October 27 & Tuesday, October 28, 2025, 10:00 AM – 4:00 PM
A comprehensive 2-day workshop that will teach the Dutch Pour on Monday & the Bloom technique on Tuesday. These two techniques are considered advanced techniques, but NO experience is required.
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS
Learn More

Just Keep Swimming
Marti Koehler
Mezzanine Gallery
Event Category:
Fine Arts
Artist Reception: Friday, November 7, 2025, 5:00 PM
“The process of making art starts with an abstract memory or feeling that sparks inspiration, leading to a colorful, gestural exploration…”

The Nightmare Before Christmas
Event Category:
Film Series
Jack Skellington, the pumpkin king of Halloween Town, is bored with doing the same thing every year for Halloween. One day he stumbles into Christmas Town…

November 1
-
December 15
Curious
Reynier Llanes
Dunham Family Gallery
Event Category:
Fine Arts
Artist Reception: Friday, November 7, 2025, 5:00 PM
Reynier Llanes is a master of color, form, and figure. The narratives are born of fables and Magic Realism where tapestries of fantasy and unlikely narratives intertwine with our reality.

I Am My Home
Mariapia Malerba
West Gallery
Event Category:
Fine Arts
Artist Reception: November 7, 2025, 5:00 PM
Without the corals, the octopus has no sanctuary…
CUSTOM EVENT BUTTONS

November 3 @ 7:00 pm
The Phoenician Scheme
Event Category:
Film Series
Wealthy businessman Zsa-zsa Korda appoints his only daughter, a nun, as sole heir to his estate. As Korda embarks on a new enterprise, they soon become the target of scheming tycoons, foreign terrorists and determined assassins.

November 5
-
November 19
GLASS-FUSED ART
Artist-Instructor: Petra Kaiser
Event Category:
Glass Fusing
Wednesdays, November 5, 12, 19, 2025,
9:30 AM – 12:30 PM
Petra will provide students with guidance and assistance, demonstrating procedures and basic glass fusing techniques, and will include compatibility and testing, annealing, and slumping.

Make A Difference
BIG ARTS has been a vital part of the Sanibel and Captiva community for over 46 years and we strive every year to make our contribution to the community better and better. Ticket and registration fees just aren’t enough to sustain a world-class fine and performing arts center, such as BIG ARTS, and we depend on donors like you to help make up the difference.

Event header Navigation « Art as Therapy; Hope and Healing Through Art Student Exhibit Florida SouthWestern State College » #tribe-events-header Sanibel School K-8 Artists Mezzanine Gallery Home Events Fine Arts Sanibel School K-8 Artists Event content May 30 - September 30 Notices The Sanibel School K–8 Artists exhibit is now on view in the Mezzanine Gallery through September 30, 2024. Featuring work from students in kindergarten through eighth grade, this vibrant showcase highlights the creativity nurtured under the direction of Sanibel School Art Teacher Erica Sharp. Families are encouraged to stop by and enjoy the colorful display — and make sure to grab a scavenger hunt! It’s a fun and interactive way for visitors of all ages to connect with the artwork and uncover hidden gems throughout the exhibit. Come celebrate the imagination and talent of Sanibel’s young artists! 2024-2025 Fine Arts Series Graciously Sponsored by Jim & Gaye Pigott Ticket link this is the add to calendar function Add to calendar Google Calendar iCalendar Outlook 365 Outlook Live INSTRUCTORS ### Event meta Details Start: May 30 End: September 30 Event Category: Fine Arts Related Events Just Keep Swimming – Marti Koehler October 27, 2025 - January 18, 2026 Curious Reynier – Llanes November 1 - December 15 I Am My Home – Mariapia Malerba November 1, 2025 - April 30, 2026 Event footer #tribe-events-content #post-x This calendar is powered by The Events Calendar. http://evnt.is/18wn

BIG ARTS
AN EXPERIENCE
BIG ARTS Programs
BIG ARTS, formally known as the
B
arrier
I
sland
G
roup for the Arts, was created by and for the community more than four decades ago. Its founding principle remains to this day: to experience and celebrate the artist in all of us and to remind us of our shared humanity. Each year we offer a vibrant cultural palette of performing and fine arts, films, workshops, classes and community events that enrich our lives. Come experience the power of the arts and the joy of coming together at BIG ARTS.

BIG ARTS
Gift Shop
Featuring one-of-a-kind items created by local artists, the BIG ARTS gift shop has unique keepsakes waiting to be discovered. Whether you are searching for a perfect gift, original décor for your home, or beautiful earrings for a night out, all are available in the BIG ARTS gift shop. Come explore the stunning artwork, exquisite pottery, handcrafted jewelry, and much more!
Explore
Support
BIG ARTS
Greats communities create great organizations; and our donors and volunteers are the heart of BIG ARTS. We have become an inspirational gathering place where artistic and educational excellence is available to all because of your support. With your help, we can continue to carry our vision forward by offering captivating programs that will enrich our community for generations to come.

Support
BIG ARTS
Greats communities create great organizations; and our donors and volunteers are the heart of BIG ARTS. We have become an inspirational gathering place where artistic and educational excellence is available to all because of your support. With your help, we can continue to carry our vision forward by offering captivating programs that will enrich our community for generations to come.
Learn more

BIG ARTS
About Us
About BIG ARTS
Great communities create great organizations – not the other way around. In 1979 BIG ARTS was created by and for the community and owes its rich history to a small band of dedicated artists who drew inspiration from each other and from the breathtaking island beauty that infused their work with grace and authenticity. They set out to create a special gathering place where artistic and educational experiences were accessible to all.
Today that vision is alive and well. With the help of our loyal donors and supporters, BIG ARTS will carry that vision forward — providing joy, inspiration and a sense of community for generations to come.
